citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A hedgehog acquired by the facility on 28 Nov 2022, was not shown to the APHIS inspectors on previous inspections. If
inspectors are not given the opportunity to visually inspect every animal in the facility’s collection, it is not possible for the
inspectors to determine if the animal welfare regulations and standards are being appropriately followed. Each exhibitor
shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials to inspect and photograph the facilities, property and animals to
enforce the provisions of the Act, the regulations and the standards.
Correct by 23 June 23

Although bloodwork and other diagnostic testing have been performed regularly and medical concerns have been
addressed in a timely manner, a complete hands-on physical exam has not been performed on one of the facility’s 12
dolphins in the past year. A complete physical exam performed by the attending veterinarian provides a more complete
picture of each animal’s health and welfare and helps to lessen the chance that a problem could be missed upon visual
examination or examination of specific issues. All cetaceans must have an exam performed by the attending veterinarian
at least annually. This examination must include, but not be limited to, a hands-on physical examination, hematology and
blood chemistry, and other diagnostic tests as determined by the attending veterinarian.
Correct by 23 June 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.126(a)(4) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A hedgehog acquired by the facility on 28 Nov 2022, was not shown to the APHIS inspectors on previous inspections. If 
inspectors are not given the opportunity to visually inspect every animal in the facility’s collection, it is not possible for the 
inspectors to determine if the animal welfare regulations and standards are being appropriately followed. Each exhibitor 
shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials to inspect and photograph the facilities, property and animals to 
enforce the provisions of the Act, the regulations and the standards. 
Correct by 23 June 23 
3.110(f) 
   
Veterinary care. 
Although bloodwork and other diagnostic testing have been performed regularly and medical concerns have been 
addressed in a timely manner, a complete hands-on physical exam has not been performed on one of the facility’s 12 
dolphins in the past year. A complete physical exam performed by the attending veterinarian provides a more complete 
picture of each animal’s health and welfare and helps to lessen the chance that a problem could be missed upon visual 
examination or examination of specific issues. All cetaceans must have an exam performed by the attending veterinarian 
at least annually. This examination must include, but not be limited to, a hands-on physical examination, hematology and 
blood chemistry, and other diagnostic tests as determined by the attending veterinarian. 
Correct by 23 June 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
